required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of The Fear of Childbirth
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of The Fear of Childbirth in Pregnant Women Who Are In The Antenatal Polyclinic: The Sample of Turkey

brief_summary.textblock: Most pregnant women have fear of labor. The reasons of fear of labor are different according to women. The investigators will examine the relationship between the descriptive features and level of fear of labor of pregnant women by using the Oxford worries about labour scale

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will give a survey to pregnant women who go to the antenatal polyclinic. The survey is consisted by researchers. The survey has a few questions about pregnant women's descriptive features. Next the investigators will evaluate the level of fear of labor of pregnant women. After the investigators will analyze the relationship between pregnant women's fear and their descriptive features.

primary_outcome.measure: The Oxford Worries About Labour Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 30 minutes, waiting in the antenatal polyclinic.
primary_outcome.description: This scale measures the level of fear of childbirth. The scale has ten questions which has four answers as Likert Scale. Also the scale has 40-100 points. As the point decreases the fear score increases.

intervention.description: Non-applicable. There is no intervention. This study is descriptive research.

study_pop.textblock: they are healthy pregnant women who are 18-35 years old. they do not have any obstetrical complications. they go to the antenatal polyclinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all of volunteers and pregnant women who are 18-35 years old.
Exclusion Criteria:
- the pregnant women have any obstetrical complications.

eligibility.gender_description: We will study with pregnant women.
